org.jsimpledb.core

Class EnumType<T extends Enum<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jsimpledb.core.FieldType<T>
      • org.jsimpledb.core.NullSafeType<T>
        • org.jsimpledb.core.EnumType<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparator<T>

    public class EnumType<T extends Enum<T>>
extends NullSafeType<T>
    Default FieldType for Enum types. Null values are supported.

    Enums present a problem because they have both a name() and an ordinal() value, and either or both of these might change over time (perhaps due to some code refactoring). Therefore, it's possible to encounter an unknown value when decoding an enum constant. To gracefully handle these situations, the binary encoding includes both the constant's ordinal()s and its name(), and when decoding an enum constant the following logic applies:

    1. If the name matches an enum constant, that constant is returned, regardless of whether the ordinal matches or not
    2. If the name does not match but the ordinal matches an enum constant, that constant is returned
    3. Otherwise, neither the name nor the ordinal matches, and null is returned

    As with all FieldTypes, a separate string encoding is also supported for enum values: this is just the enum name surrounded by square brackets. If an unrecognized name is encountered when decoding from a string, null is returned.
